org.jruyi.common

Interface IService

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ISessionService
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Service

    public interface IService
    Defines the life cycle methods that a service need implement.

    A service has five states: Inactive, Stopped, Active, Starting and Stopping. The initial state of a service is Stopped.

    State transition is as follows: 

     {Stopped|Inactive}-(start)-Starting-{(success)->Active|(fail)->Inactive}
 Active-(stop)-Stopping->Stopped
 Inactive-(stop)->Stopped

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int ACTIVE
      An int value representing Active state.
      static int INACTIVE
      An int value representing Inactive state.
      static int STARTING
      An int value representing Starting state.
      static int STOPPED
      An int value representing Stopped state.
      static int STOPPING
      An int value representing Stopping state.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        void start()
           throws Exception
        Starts this service.
        Throws:
        Exception - thrown if this service failed to start

      • start

        void start(int options)
           throws Exception
        Starts this service with the specified options. It's up to the service implementation to define its own start options.
        Parameters:
        options - start options
        Throws:
        Exception - thrown if this service failed to start

      • stop

        void stop()
        Stops this service.

      • stop

        void stop(int options)
        Stops this service with the specified options. It's up to the service implementation to define its own stop options.
        Parameters:
        options - stop options

      • update

            throws Exception
        Updates the properties of this service.
        Parameters:
        properties - the properties to be updated to
        Throws:
        Exception - if any error occurs
